metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28044 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Irzip v0.640 was discovered to contain a heap memory corruption via the component lrzip.c:initialise_control.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lrzip - 0.616-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lrzip package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.616-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
